_prev_prog_3.Description: QE-1 Production Unit. The system is equipped with a sprinkler system as well as gas detection sensors into a central Loss Prevention System (LPS) which is annunciated in the QE-1 CCR.  The equipment is located inside the unit boundary.  The process area is covered with a concrete slab and is equipped with an underground drain system which is routed to the unit wastewater collection and treatment system.
Q1 Production Unit. The storage tanks are located in dikes.  Various area gas detectors are in place for monitoring.  All loading and unloading activities are continiously monitored by operations.
AB3 Production Unit. The storage tanks are located in dikes.  Various area gas detectors are in place for monitoring.  All loading and unloading activities are continiously monitored by operations.

_prev_prog_3.MH_OtherType: Vacuum on Pyrolysis Gasoline Product tank
_prev_prog_3.Description: QE-1 Pygas Tank. The storage tank is equipped with a foam deluge system, as well as gas detection sensors into a central Loss Prevention System (LPS) which is annunciated in the QE-1 CCR and the tank is located within a concrete containment system.
QE-1 C4 Spheres. Each storage tank is equipped with a water curtain system.  The tanks are located within a concrete containment system.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

LyondellBasell is committed to employee, public and environmental safety. This commitment is inherent to an accidental release prevention program in place that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the processes at LyondellBasell La Porte. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances. If such a release does occur, our trained emergency response personnel are at hand to control and mitigate the effects of the release. We are also coordinated with Channel Industries Mutual Aid (CIMA) which provides additional emergency response expertise.



2. The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled 

LyondellBasell La Porte's primary activities encompass olefins, and polymer and resins manufacturing. We have 25 regulated substances present at LyondellBasell La Porte in quantities greater than or equal to their threshold quantities (as listed below). 



    

Acetaldehyde    

Acetylene    

Ammonia

1,3 Butadiene    

Butane            

1-Butene    

2-Butene    

Butene             

2-Butene-cis    

2-Butene-trans    

Ethane            

Ethylene    

Hydrogen    

Isobutane        

Isoprene    

Methane            

3-Methyl-1-butene    

2-Methyl-1-butene    

Propadiene    

Propane            

Propyne            

Vinyl Acetylene    

Isopentane    

Vinyl Acetate    

Propylene    





3. The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps 

LyondellBasell La Porte has taken the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements set out under 40 CFR Part 68. This facility was designed and constructed in accordance with NFPA-58 Standard, (1967 Edition). A number of processes at LyondellBasell La Porte are subject to the OSHA PSM standard under 29 CFR 1910.119.



The following sections briefly describe the elements of our release prevention program that are in p

lace at LyondellBasell La Porte. Regarding Process Safety Information, LyondellBasell La Porte maintains a record of written safety information that describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with all processes. Regarding Process Hazard Analysis, LyondellBasell La Porte conducts studies to ensure that hazards associated with our processes are identified and controlled efficiently. The methodologies used to carry out these analyses are unit Process Hazard Analysis. The studies are undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and are revalidated on an as needed basis. Any findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner.



Operating Procedures

For the purposes of safely conducting activities within our covered processes, LyondellBasell La Porte maintains written operating procedures. These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown and startup after a turnaround. The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved with the processes.



Training

LyondellBasell La Porte has a training program in place to ensure that employees that are operating processes are competent in the operating procedures associated with these processes. New employees receive basic training in process operations followed by on-the-job supervision until they are deemed competent to work independently. Refresher training is provided at least every three years and more frequently as needed.



Mechanical Integrity

LyondellBasell La Porte carries out documented maintenance checks on process equipment to ensure proper functions. Process equipment examined by these checks includes among others; pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls and pumps. Maintena

nce operations are carried out by qualified personnel with previous training in maintenance practices. Furthermore, these personnel are offered specialized training as needed. Any equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.



Management of Change

Written procedures are in place at LyondellBasell La Porte to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and procedures. Process operators, maintenance personnel or any other employee whose job tasks are affected by a modification in process conditions are promptly made aware of and offered training to deal with the modification.



Pre-Startup Safety Reviews

Pre-start up safety reviews related to new processes and to modifications in established processes are conducted as a regular practice at LyondellBasell La Porte. These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.



Compliance Audits

LyondellBasell La Porte conducts audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set out under the RMP rule are being implemented. These audits are carried out at least every 5 years and any corrective actions required as a result of the audits are undertaken in a safe and prompt manner. Additionally, all of our compliance management systems are audited by outside resources on a regular basis.



Incident Investigation 

LyondellBasell La Porte investigates incidents that have resulted in, or could reasonably result in, an employee injury or a significant release of a hazardous material. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring. All reports are retained for a minimum of 5 years.



Employee Participation

LyondellBasell La Porte believes that process safety management and accident prevention is a team eff

ort. Company employees are encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, our employees have access to all information created as part of the facility's implementation to the RMP rule in particular information resulting from process hazard analyses.



Contractors

Our company hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities. Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of safety performance of the contractor is carried out. LyondellBasell La Porte has a strict policy of informing the contractors of known potential hazards related the contractor's work and the processes. Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response should an accidental release of a regulated substance occur.  Contractor post evaluations are also conducted to ensure compliance with LyondellBasell safety and health procedures.   



4. Five Year Accident History

There have been no accidental releases in the past five years that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage,



5. Emergency Response Plan

LyondellBasell La Porte carries a written emergency response plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials. The plan includes emergency response activities including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas. To ensure proper functioning, our emergency response equipment is regularly inspected and serviced. In addition, the plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place within our processes that would require a modified emergency response. The La Porte Police Department is the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) with which our emergency plan has been coordinated.



6. Emerge

ncy Response Team

LyondellBasell La Porte has gone above and beyond the normal safety requirements to provide employees with a safe working environment. One program that enhances our ability to respond to emergencies is our Emergency Response Program. Members of the Emergency Response Team (ERT) undergo training that includes classroom and on-the-job training as well as regular emergency drills. A highly trained and confident ERT can limit damage during an emergency event, but more importantly prompt emergency response can prevent more serious accidents from occurring. Our teams regularly attend some of the best training programs available, in particular, the programs conducted at Texas A&M University.





Planned changes to improve safety: The plant has planned improvements to alarm systems, safety interlocks systems, and level control systems to improve safety at the site.
